did.abstract: Abigail Cleaveland was born to Thankful Paine and Aaron Cleaveland in Canterbury, Connecticut. She married Parker Cleaveland, the son of Separatist minister Rev. John Cleaveland, and moved to Byfield, Massachusetts. Her son, John Payne Cleaveland, became a Congregational minister. This collection contains a single manuscript volume of sacred and secular music kept by Abigail Cleaveland.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Abigail Cleaveland (1759-1834) was born to Thankful Paine and Aaron Cleaveland in Canterbury, Connecticut. During the Revolutionary War, her father and brother served in the Continental Army. After marrying Parker Cleaveland, the son of Separatist minister Rev. John Cleaveland, she moved to Byfield, Massachusetts and joined the church there in 1795. Her son, John Payne Cleaveland, became a Congregational minister and was ordained at the Salem Tabernacle Church in 1827.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains a single manuscript volume of sacred and secular music kept by Abigail Cleaveland. The majority of the recorded music is sacred, though there are a few secular melodies recorded as well.
